meanings.definition: To fall or drop straight down at a high speed.
meanings.sent1: The bird quickly plummets from the sky to catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: The price of the stock plummets when bad news is announced.
meanings.sent3: As the elevator cable snaps, the elevator plummets comically to the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her heart plummets when she realizes she missed the last train home.
meanings.sent5: The temperature plummets as the sun sets, signaling the start of a cold night.

meanings.definition: A weight attached to a line used for determining the depth of water or for locating a position on the sea bed.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman used a heavy plummet to sink his fishing line deep into the water.
meanings.sent2: The diver's equipment included a metal plummet to help her descend smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The playful seal mistook the plummet for a toy and tried to play with it underwater.
meanings.sent4: The ancient sailors relied on the accuracy of the plummet to navigate the treacherous waters.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist discovered a centuries-old plummet while exploring the sunken ship.
